title: Transactional Distance Theory (TDT)-Based Educational Modeling Language (EML) Design Workshop for Mathematics Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design principles and mathematics subject knowledge
context.additional_context: Strengthening competency in designing math learning with VR simulations within smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: The quality metrics of mathematics learning design can be measured by applying the three elements of TDT (distance, dialogue, structure).
Interactive mathematics learning scenarios can be detailed using the SDLD approach.
Reusable VR-based mathematics learning modules can be designed for limited-technology environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
